intro: Tarenna longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stemmed tarenna, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. It is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature, containing several seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
